Ten years after the migration crisis, Germany assesses Merkel's 'Wir schaffen das' legacy
subhead: 'We will manage,' Chancellor Angela Merkel declared on August 31, 2015, as hundreds of thousands of refugees, particularly from Syria, sought asylum in the country. Studies show her proactive integration policy has yielded positive results, even though the issue remains divisive.

title: Hamas bears overwhelming responsibility for the Palestinian catastrophe
French PM Bayrou should 'say goodbye,' says Socialist leader
How Republicans and Democrats are redrawing US congressional maps to their advantage
subhead: The battle over redistricting is intensifying in the US ahead of the crucial November 2026 midterm elections, with maneuvers from Texas to California likely to shape the outcome.

title: In Hawaii, the volcano's repentants: 'I see it as a metaphor for the misuse of our planet's resources'
subhead: 'Of Volcanoes and Men' (3/6). In Hawaii, there is a local belief that the goddess Pele brings misfortune to careless visitors who dare to take a piece of volcanic earth with them. To ward off this 'curse,' many return their stolen souvenirs along with a note of apology. Photographer Ryan Thompson compiled these testimonies of repentance.

title: Evangelicalism in France continues to grow, driven by conversions
subhead: Members of evangelical churches, a branch of Protestantism, are increasing. These believers say they are drawn by a more informal liturgy and the emphasis on community.
byline: By Sarah Belouezzane and Benoît Vitkine

title: Lorde, New Zealand electropop sensation: 'With 'Virgin,' I wanted to document my femininity'
subhead: Twelve years ago, while still a teenager, the singer rose to fame with her hit song 'Royals.' Quickly endorsed by some of the biggest names in music, the 28-year-old's unique voice and bold songwriting were a departure from music industry standards. She has just released her raw fourth album, 'Virgin,' and will perform at the Zénith in Paris on November 10.

title: Vanessa Paradis, a French icon
subhead: Recognized today as both a singer and an actress, the artist still appears affected by the attacks she suffered early during her fame. With the release of her eighth album 'Le Retour des beaux jours' ('The Return of Sunny Days'), Paradis agreed to an interview, but remained on her guard.

title: Mohammed Hilles' first days in France after arriving from Gaza: 'I went to a baroque concert at the Philharmonie. It filled me with joy, sadness and nostalgia'
subhead: Hilles, 25, left Gaza to study music at Paris-Saclay University. After the initial relief of his arrival, he has grown increasingly worried about his family in the Palestinian enclave.

title: Are tariffs good for the climate?
subhead: In France, half of all greenhouse gas emissions are generated by imports. Would reducing global trade through tariffs therefore improve the country's carbon footprint? The answer is not so straightforward.
